Player History
Drafted in 3rd round, 71st overall pick, by Northeastern in 1964...
Injured on 8/22/1965 with a Bruised Hand, out for 5 days...
Injured on 8/21/1969 with a Pulled Abdominal Muscle, out for one week...
Had first career hit on 5/30/1970, off Walton Diemer (NJ)...
Hit first career homerun on 6/27/1970, off Roger Murray (MAN)...
Signed as a free agent by Coney Island on 2/7/1976 to a 2-year deal worth $1,555,000 per year...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Catcher in 1976...
Won Player of the Week award on 4/7/1977, hitting .421 with 4 HR, 10 RBI...
Signed as a free agent by Manchester on 2/1/1978 to a 4-year deal worth $1,000,000 per year...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Catcher in 1981...
Signed as a free agent by Plum Grove on 2/14/1982 to a 4-year deal worth $604,800 per year...
Released by Plum Grove on 4/7/1983...
